notes.text:
Don't oversoak the biscuits
Use good quality espresso
Best made a day ahead

steps.descr: Whisk egg yolks with sugar until pale and thick

on_enter.say: Right, let's get started by whisking those egg yolks with sugar until they're beautifully pale and thick. You'll know it's ready when it looks nice and creamy.

steps.instructions: Whisk egg yolks with sugar until pale and thick

on_enter.say: Now, let's beat in the mascarpone until it's smooth and luscious. It should look silky and rich.

steps.descr: Whip egg whites to stiff peaks, fold into mascarpone

on_enter.say: Let's whip those egg whites until they form stiff peaks. Then, gently fold them into the mascarpone mixture. It'll be light and airy!

steps.instructions: Whip egg whites to stiff peaks, fold into mascarpone

on_enter.say: Now, let's mix the cooled espresso with the Marsala wine. This is going to give our tiramisu that classic, rich flavour.

steps.descr: Dip ladyfingers briefly in coffee, layer in dish

on_enter.say: Time to dip those ladyfingers briefly in the coffee mixture and layer them in your dish. Just a quick dip, you don't want them too soggy!

steps.instructions: Dip ladyfingers briefly in coffee, layer in dish

steps.descr: Spread half the mascarpone cream, repeat layers

on_enter.say: Let's spread half of that lovely mascarpone cream over the ladyfingers, then repeat the layers. It's all about building those beautiful flavours.

steps.instructions: Spread half the mascarpone cream, repeat layers

steps.descr: Refrigerate 4 hours, dust with cocoa before serving

on_enter.say: Fantastic! Now, pop it in the fridge for at least 4 hours to let all those flavours meld together. Just before serving, give it a nice dusting of cocoa powder. It'll be worth the wait!

steps.instructions: Refrigerate 4 hours, dust with cocoa before serving

recipe.title: Tiramisu
recipe.description: Classic Italian dessert with coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone
